name: SpringHill Suites Vancouver Columbia Tech Center

reviews.text: I enjoyed my 2-night stay at this SpringHill suites. Specifically, I liked the extra friendly greeting upon arrival. The clerk shared parking tips, location tips and when I asked for directions to an office-supply store, she not only found the information but she offered to help me with copies. It was an unexpected and refreshing encounter.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with standard SpringHill amenities

reviews.text: I also liked the cleanliness of my room, as well as the typical SpringHill suites amenities (suite-style rooms with a small kitchenette/fridge area).
reviews.title: Great room, perfect location!

reviews.text: The location was perfect, with a Whole Foods across the street plus several other restaurant and shopping choices nearby.
reviews.title: Not bad

reviews.text: My only complaint is about the business center in the hotel lobby. Since the hotel has "tech" in it's name, I expected to see a contemporary computer and printer available. I had trouble printing a presentation because PowerPoint wasn't even installed on it (only the "viewer" version, which has limited options). So I would not recommend relying on the hotel's business center if you need to do any work during your stay.
reviews.title: Helpful, friendly staff

reviews.text: I stayed at the SpringHill Suites in Vancouver for a week while visiting my daughter. She helped me pick it because the location was so convenient to her house.
reviews.title: Comfy Bed, Great Continental Breakfast

reviews.text: This is a great location with lots of places to eat during your stay. The hotel has free Internet and the rooms are good size. Morning breakfast is a hot meal and quick and easy.
reviews.title: Great place to stay when visiting HP

reviews.text: We stayed there for three nights and had two suites - one king and one with two queen beds. The rooms were clean and well appointed. The service, in general, was excellent. Breakfast was good, however, they started closing it down five to ten minutes before closing and were merciless about it. So, do not expect much food the last ten minutes and they do not refill anything that has run out by that time. If you are booking this hotel please remember that breakfast is included in the standard room rate but we did not know it and ended up paying extra for it. The website is not clear about this.
reviews.title: Great facility and good business hotel

reviews.text: I need a very clean hotel due to health issues and this one fits the bill, plus the staff is very understanding of my special cleanliness needs. I got great smiling service here. A huge plus.
reviews.title: Clean, Bright, Great Service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the best, cleanest, and well-maintained breakfast buffets I've seen. Fresh, hot, and good. Even steamed rice and nori sometimes. I love the variety (and the salsa, fresh walnuts, and raisins too.)
reviews.title: Excellent value, clean and newish.

reviews.text: Great location too. Close to great stores including Whole Foods and the new Chuck's Produce and Delicatessen. Walk to the movies and Whole Foods as well as area restaurants. A very clean community. Felt very safe.
reviews.title: Enjoyable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here while relocating this spring. The staff was AMAZING! Everyone from the housekeeping to front desk to the breakfast servers. Hotel was spotless. Housekeeping kept our room VERY clean. Front desk staff was always pleasant. WE recommend this hotel and WILL be back! Thanks Again!
reviews.title: Extended Stay- Amazing Staff

reviews.text: Stayed here three nights. The kids enjoyed the indoor pool. Breakfast is complimentary and average - good selection, a few hot items. The rooms and lobby are pleasant. GREAT location if you are in East Vancouver for business or pleasure. Many restaurant choices within walking distance.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first stay at this hotel chain, and overall we were happy with the cleanliness and quality of the suite--especially given the nightly rate. However, we both found the bed uncomfortable and neither of us could get a good night's sleep. Even with the pillow-top mattress, you could still feel the springs and they were pretty stiff.
reviews.title: Get better mattresses

reviews.text: While you could definitely hear other guests in the hallway and in rooms above, the amount of noise was comparable to other recently-constructed hotels we've stayed at.
reviews.title: Excellent choice around Portland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The complimentary breakfast was good, but the coffee leaves a lot to be desired.
reviews.title: great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an older generation Springhill that is very clean and well-maintained. The staff is friendly and the location is excellent. It is 3 miles from the I-205/Mill Plains Blvd interchange. It has scheduled free transportation to PDX but does not pick up from PDX (some state law prohibtion)
reviews.title: VERY GOOD SUBURBAN OPTION

reviews.text: PROS:
reviews.title: Good base location for local visiting

reviews.text: --all the usual Springhill amenities (fridge, microwave, free HSIA, continental+ breakfast)
reviews.title: A pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: --abundant free parking
reviews.title: Give me a Hilton anyday

reviews.text: --free local calls; free Sunday paper
reviews.title: great place for a biz or family stay

aka: Springhill Suites Vancouver Columbia Tech Hotel Vancouver
